section.title: About the Dashboard
section.para: The eXist-db Dashboard is the central application launchpad and administration facility for eXist-db. Much like a tablet or smartphone home screen, the Dashboard displays a list of applications, or "apps". In the Dashboard

The default apps installed in eXist-db relate to administration and assist with application development. The database administration apps include: Admin Web Application, Collections, Shutdown, Backup, Package Manager, and User Manager. The application development applications include: eXide XQuery IDE.

section.title: Using the Dashboard
section.para: To enter an app, select its icon.

To find new apps to install, select the Package Manager app and browse the list of applications and code library packages available from eXist-db's public repository. This repository is eXist-db's equivalent of an "app store". Detailed information about each package can be viewed by selecting the Show Details checkbox in the upper-right corner. If you want to connect to a different repository, select the gear button and enter the repository's URL.

To install an app from the repository, select the app; this will reveal a gear-shaped install button. You can also install packages stored on your filesystem; just select the gear icon in the top-left corner of the main Package Manage pane to bring up the Upload dialog, then click on the "Click to select .xar package" to browse your filesystem to find the .xar package, then select "Submit" to upload the package to eXist-db for installation. Once installed, a new app will appear in the Dashboard landing page.

Deleting an unwanted application is as simple as hovering the mouse over an app's icon, which reveals a trashcan icon; click on the trashcan icon to delete the app. Alternatively, from the Package Manager app, select an installed app and click on the orange-tinted gear button.

section.title: On Apps vs. Plugins
section.para: The Dashboard supports both "apps", which are self-contained applications providing their own web GUI, as well as "plugins": simple, single-screen dialogs which run inside the dashboard. The eXist-db Documentation App, eXide, and eXist-db Demo App are apps, while the Collection Browser, Shutdown, Backup, Package Manager, and User Manager are plugins. Plugins are most suitable for administrative functions.

Plugins are loaded and unloaded on demand via dojo's AMD loader. They are modular, self-contained units. To add a new plugin, you need to provide an HTML and a plugin.js file, which defines a subclass of the base plugin class.

Future plans for plugins include the addition of a template plugin to help others understand how to set up a plugin, and XForms support, which would make plugin authoring a lot easier but requires an update to betterform.
